The light travels from air (refractive index n1 = 1) into the material (refractive index n2 = √3). Using Snell’s Law at the interface: n1 sin i = n2 sin r, 1 · sin 60° = √3 · sin r, sin 60° = √3/2, √3/2 = √3 · sin r, sin r = 1/2.
